title: Is Wikipedia dead? OpenAI's GPT-5.2 turns to Elon Musk's Grokipedia for real-time answers
snippet: OpenAI's GPT-5.2 was caught turning to Elon Musk's Grokipedia for real time answers, according to a latest report. The news comes at a time when Musk and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman have been fighting it out on social media.

title: Redmi Note 15 Pro launching in India on 29 October: Pre-order details, specs, expected price and more
snippet: Xiaomi's Redmi Note 15 Pro+ will launch in India on January 29, with pre-bookings now open on Amazon. The device features a 6.83-inch OLED display, MediaTek Dimensity 7400 Ultra processor, 200MP camera, and a 6,500mAh battery, with pre-booking priced at  ₹1,990.

title: Massive breach exposes 149 million Instagram, Gmail, OnlyFans passwords: How to stay safe?
snippet: A cybersecurity breach has exposed 149 million login credentials from various online services, including social media and streaming platforms. The data was left unsecured and accessible via an infostealer malware.&nbsp;

title: No more AI friends: Meta cuts off teen access to characters on Instagram and Facebook
snippet: Meta is temporarily restricting teens' access to its AI characters across all its apps like Instagram, Facebook and Messenger. The ban would apply to users who have teen birthdays and suspected teens.&nbsp;

title: Your App Store search is about to change: Apple confirms multiple ad slots are coming to iPhone in March
snippet: Apple will increase ads on the App Store starting March, first in the UK and Japan, followed by other markets. This move aims to enhance developer opportunities and generate additional revenue, with ads appearing in new positions during searches, impacting user experience.

title: WWE 2K26 'Attitude Edition' announced during SmackDown: Expected release date, roster, and legendary cover art
snippet: WWE has officially unveiled the WWE 2K26 'Attitude Era' Edition, celebrating the iconic period in profressional wresting from late 1990s to early 2000s. The Pre-orders for the game will begin on January 30, 2026

title: WhatsApp could finally let new group members see past messages on iPhone: here's how it works
snippet: WhatsApp is testing a new feature that allows current group members to share chat history with new members, providing context from previous conversations. This feature, available in the latest iOS update, enables sharing up to 100 messages from the last 14 days, though it's off by default.

title: It makes sense that people see AI as God
snippet: Public discourse increasingly frames artificial intelligence in religious, even apocalyptic terms. title: Login credentials of 149 million accounts including Gmail, Facebook, Netflix leaked: Report
snippet: The report published by cybersecurity researcher Jeremiah Fowler claims that the publicly exposed data includes 48 million accounts on Gmail, 4 million on Yahoo, 17 million on Facebook, 6.5 million on Instagram, 3.4 million on Netflix, 1.5 million on Outlook, etc.

title: AI can revolutionise governance if aligned with democratic values: Kerala CM
snippet: Addressing a gathering after inaugurating the valedictory session of the Kerala Regional AI Impact Conference organised by the IndiaAI Mission on Friday, Vijayan outlined the state government's vision to integrate AI into administration to enhance transparency, efficiency and public participation.

title: Elon Musk vs Ryanair CEO: All you need to know about the tech world’s unlikely feud
snippet: A dispute over the cost and aerodynamics of Starlink’s in-flight Wi-Fi has blown up into a public war of words between Elon Musk and Ryanair chief Michael O’Leary. What began as a technical debate is now a full-blown business and personality clash.

snippet: The Singapore government will invest ‍over S$1 billion ($778.8 ​million) in public artificial intelligence research through ⁠2030 to strengthen the nation's capabilities and global competitiveness, it said on Saturday.

title: Everyone wants AI sovereignty. No one can truly have it.
